Program Description: This program helps newcomers with permanent resident status, refugee status, or Canadian citizenship improve their English language skills and prepares them for post-secondary studies and future careers. It offers various learning areas such as listening, speaking, reading, writing, and vocabulary improvement, among others.
Certified teachers guide students through interactive lessons, both in-person and online. Students can choose one of three routes at Levels 7 or 8: [Specific information on the three routes not provided]

Related programs: General Arts and Science – English for Academic Purposes (for International Students) (R115), Practical Nursing (PN) (S121), Dental Hygiene (S134)

Context:
The EAP (English for Academic Purposes) program at George Brown College offers three routes to take at Levels 7 and 8: continuing in the post-secondary stream of the EAP program, pursuing English for Business Studies, or pursuing English for Hospitality Studies. Students can also opt for selective courses to develop specific communication skills, critical thinking abilities, digital expertise, and academic know-how (Semesters span two levels, each lasting 16 weeks; classes take place Monday–Friday from 9 AM–1 PM).

The program consists of nine levels, with placement determined by a placement test or official English exam score (IELTS, TOEFL, or Duolingo). Students can finish Level 8 to meet the English language requirement for most certificates and diplomas at George Brown College, while completing Level 9 prepares students with study, research, and essay-writing skills.

Upon completion of Level 8 or 9 and finishing at least two EAP levels at George Brown College, students will earn an Ontario College Certificate (Level 8 graduates) or a George Brown College Certificate (Level 9 graduates). Exemptions from English admissions tests vary based on the program requirements.

Program Dates and Duration:
- Academic Year: 2023 - 2024
- Placement Test Start Dates: August 22, 2023; September 5, 2023; December 21, 2023; December 19, 2023; January 8, 2024; April 26, 2024; April 23, 2024; May 6, 2024; August 23, 2024
- Certification: Ontario College Certificate (Level 8) or George Brown College Certificate (Level 9)

Context:
The text provides information about the English for Academic Purposes (EAP) program offered at George Brown College. Students are required to complete two courses per semester in this program, with a total of nine levels. The students may choose between online or in-person classes for these courses.

Upon successful completion of EAP Level 8, students meet the English language requirements for admission to some diploma and certificate programs at 16 other Ontario colleges. The graduates of this program will have developed competent communication skills required for post-secondary studies, interacting culturally appropriately in various environments, conducting research, and writing essays/papers/reports according to academic conventions. They also gain thorough knowledge in a wide range of subjects and insights into themselves and society.

Required courses for the EAP program include ESL 1111 through ESL 1119. Students can start the program by taking a level placement test at George Brown or submitting an official, valid IELTS (Academic) or TOEFL (iBT) or Duolingo test score during admission or before classes begin. Students may only choose one of these options. Some programs require mandatory admission testing which includes English. For more information on program requirements and articulation agreements, students should contact the School of ESL.

Context:
* The program requires students to develop communicative competence, understand critical thinking processes, examine various aspects of society, and employ vocational skills from humanities, social and behavioural sciences or vocational studies (business, technology).
* Estimated tuition for one semester is $1,841.00*. Domestic fees for September, January, and May are $1,581.79 each, with additional costs of $300.21 (September) or $207.82 (January and May) for health insurance. The OCAS application fee is $110.
* The program is eligible for OSAP funding.
* Admission requirements include an Ontario Secondary School Diploma (OSSD), mature student status, and permanent residency in Canada. All applicants must complete a placement test to determine their English proficiency level before beginning the EAP program.
* Placement tests can be taken either at George Brown College or through Duolingo for students without an IELTS, TOEFL, or Duolingo score.
* Applicants must achieve a minimum level 1 on the placement test to be considered for the program.
* Fees are subject to change and it is recommended that students verify George Brown College fee requirements.
* The application deadline is not specified in the text.
* The text does not provide any contact information or email addresses for the college.

Context:
EAP (English for Academic Purposes) applicants can be placed into an EAP level before classes start based on their IELTS, TOEFL, or Duolingo scores. The minimum writing and speaking score requirements for each test are listed below:

Duolingo: 0-9 (Two-year test validation maximum)
IELTS: Overall score of 105+, Writing & Speaking score of 6.5 or higher
TOEFL: Overall score of 80–91, Speaking score of 20, Writing score of 22 or higher

Students will be placed in the EAP starting level that corresponds to their lowest score in all test sections. Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges. Current or returning EAP students who suspend their studies for more than six consecutive eight-week sessions must retake the EAP level placement test or submit a valid IELTS/TOEFL/Duolingo score.

Applicants interested in taking the IELTS test in Toronto can use the George Brown College official IELTS test centre for complete testing services. For more information, please visit the IELTS Testing service site.

Contact the School of ESL office at 416-415-5000, ext. 4826 or email esl@georgebrown.ca for more information about George Brown College. Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges.

Students who fail to attend the EAP level placement test or submit a valid IELTS/TOEFL/Duolingo score will not be placed into the program.
